member.name: P:BVSoftware.Bvc5.Core.BusinessEntityBase.Bvin
member.summary: BV Identification Number, a unique GUID value that ensures the object can be moved between databases without losing references to related objects
member.remarks: If a class is saved without a BVIN, one will automatically be created. If a class is saved with a BVIN, the existing object will be updated instead.

member.name: P:BVSoftware.Bvc5.Core.BusinessEntityBase.LastUpdated
member.summary: Lists the last time the object was updated in the database
member.remarks: This value is overwritten every time the object is saved.

member.name: M:BVSoftware.Bvc5.Core.BusinessRules.OrderTasks.CredExCheckCredit.Execute(BVSoftware.Bvc5.Core.BusinessRules.OrderTaskContext)
member.summary: Makes a call to the CredEx Service with customer and order information. If the call succeeds, a url is returned The url is stored with the order so that the CredExStart task can redirect to this location where the customer will enter their CredEx authentication information upon entering the auth information, the CredEx service will do an async postback allowing BV to mark the order as paid, in the meantime, the customer is returned to the receipt page in BV

member.remarks: Only set properties on this class which you would like to use when searching.

member.summary: Validates that a given card number matches the format and mod10 formula for a given type

member.name: M:BVSoftware.Bvc5.Core.Utilities.UrlRewriter.ResolveUrl(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a site relative HTTP path from a partial path starting out with a ~. Same syntax that ASP.Net internally supports but this method can be used outside of the Page framework.
Works like Control.ResolveUrl including support for ~ syntax but returns an absolute URL.
member.param: Any Url including those starting with ~

member.name: M:BVSoftware.Bvc5.Core.Utilities.UrlRewriter.ResolveServerUrl(System.String)
member.summary:
This method returns a fully qualified absolute server Url which includes the protocol, server, port in addition to the server relative Url.
It work like Page.ResolveUrl, but adds these to the beginning. This method is useful for generating Urls for AJAX methods
member.param: Any Url, either App relative or fully qualified

member.name: M:BVSoftware.Bvc5.Core.Utilities.UrlRewriter.ResolveServerUrl(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This method returns a fully qualified absolute server Url which includes the protocol, server, port in addition to the server relative Url.
Works like Control.ResolveUrl including support for ~ syntax but returns an absolute URL.
member.param: Any Url, either App relative or fully qualified
if true forces the url to use https
